page.title: 15PROTECTED BUILDINGS <CONT.>
page.content: Perhaps the most interesting building in Stockland is the Cider House belonging to Percy Copp.This is situated 12m.east of Churchstyle Farm House and could be as early as C16.Cider is still made here behind a strong boarded door.It is a small cob building with a thatched roof. The houses on the Yarcombe Road are also a delight.Kite's Cottage,probably the oldest building in Stockland, is circa 1500.This stands on the corner opposite the Post Office.The White House is a marvellous example of late Georgian architecture.The King's Thatch used to be a public house and before that a row of cottages.These houses make Stockland a most beautiful village in which to browse around.
